dataSources.label: Agricultural Survey
dataSources.description: Information about U.S. agricultural production, economics, demographics and the environment, provided by the National Agricultural Statistics Service agricultural survey.

dataSources.label: Census of Agriculture
dataSources.description:
Information about land use, operators, production, and finances of U.S. farms and ranches. Data Commons contains several of the census tables relating to crop production and operator demographics from the 2017 census.

[Policies and links](https://www.usda.gov/policies-and-links)

dataSourceGroups.label: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UN OCHA)

dataSources.label: Sri Lanka Census
dataSources.description: Sri Lanka demographics, education and agriculture statistics at the country, province and district levels.

dataSources.label: The Molecular INTeraction (MINT) Database
dataSources.description:
Focuses on experimentally verified protein-protein interactions mined from the scientific literature by expert curators.

Licata, Luana, Leonardo Briganti, Daniele Peluso, Livia Perfetto, Marta Iannuccelli, Eugenia Galeota, Francesca Sacco et al. "MINT, the molecular interaction database: 2012 update." Nucleic acids research 40, no. D1 (2012): D857-D861.

dataSources.label: Experimental Data
dataSources.description:
Contains information for approximately 7000 experiments along with 14,000 BED files collected by The Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) Consortium. Examples of experiment metadata captured include the target biosample, assay type, gene assembly, etc. Data Commons include the metadata for all experimental datasets in ENCODE as of 2019.

Data made available under the [ENCODE data use policy for external users](https://www.encodeproject.org/help/citing-encode/). This data was formatted for Data Commons through a collaboration with Dr. Anthony Oro’s group at Stanford University.

dataSourceGroups.label: European Molecular Biology Laboratory - European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI)

dataSources.label: UniProt
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes protein sequence and functional information including protein interaction with chemical compounds maintained by the UniProt Consortium. The data is made available by the [Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY 4.0) License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Further information on UniProt License and Disclaimer can be found [here](https://www.uniprot.org/help/license). The UniProt Consortium states [how to cite](https://www.uniprot.org/help/publications) UniProt data used in a journal article.

Data made available by the [EMBL-EPI terms of use](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use/)

dataSources.label: The Sequence Ontology
dataSources.description:
"The Sequence Ontology is a set of terms and relationships used to describe the features and attributes of biological sequence. SO includes different kinds of features which can be located on the sequence. Biological features are those which are defined by their disposition to be involved in a biological process. Examples are 'binding site' and 'exon'. Biomaterial features are those which are intended for use in an experiment such as aptamer and PCR_product. There are also experimental features which are the result of an experiment. SO also provides a rich set of attributes to describe these features such as 'polycistronic' and 'maternally imprinted'."

Gene Ontology Consortium data and data products are licensed under the [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Unported License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode). When using or citing GO data please mention the particular release. For example, include where applicable the date (e.g. '2024-01-17'), Zenodo DOI (e.g. '10.5281/zenodo.10536401'), and links. More information on licensing and attribution in regards to the Gene Ontology Consortium can be found [here](https://geneontology.org/docs/go-citation-policy/).

dataSourceGroups.label: International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses (ICTV)

dataSources.label: Master Species List
dataSources.description: The official, current virus taxonomy approved by the ICTV. To accomplish the task of organizing and maintaining this virus taxonomy, the ICTV is composed of 7 subcommittees covering Animal DNA viruses and Retroviruses, Animal dsRNA and ssRNA (-) viruses, Animal ssRNA (+) viruses, Bacterial viruses, Archaeal Viruses, Fungal and Protist viruses, and Plant viruses. The ICTV has established over 100 international Study Groups (SGs) covering all major virus families and genera. The MSL version currently in the graph is MSL38 v3 released on 2023-09-11.

dataSources.label: Virus Metadata Resource
dataSources.description:
The ICTV chooses an exemplar virus for each species and the VMR provides a list of these exemplars. An exemplar virus serves as an example of a well-characterized virus isolate of that species and includes the GenBank accession number for the genomic sequence of the isolate as well as the virus name, isolate designation, suggested abbreviation, genome composition, and host source. The VMR version currently in the graph is VMR MSL38 v2 released on 2023-09-13.

Data made available under Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0).

dataSources.label: DISEASES: Experiment
dataSources.description: DISEASES is a weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on disease-gene associations from automatic text mining, manually curated literature, cancer mutation data, and genome-wide association studies. This dataset further unifies the evidence by assigning confidence scores that facilitate comparison of the different types and sources of evidence. All files start with the following four columns: gene identifier, gene name, disease identifier, and disease name. The knowledge files further contain the source database, the evidence type, and the confidence score. For further details please refer to the following Open Access articles about the database: [DISEASES: Text mining and data integration of disease-gene associations](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1046202314003831) and [DISEASES 2.0: a weekly updated database of disease–gene associations from text mining and data integration](https://academic.oup.com/database/article/doi/10.1093/database/baac019/6554833?login=false). The data is made available under the [CC-BY](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license.

dataSources.label: DISEASES: Knowledge
dataSources.description: DISEASES is a weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on disease-gene associations from automatic text mining, manually curated literature, cancer mutation data, and genome-wide association studies. This dataset further unifies the evidence by assigning confidence scores that facilitate comparison of the different types and sources of evidence. All files start with the following four columns: gene identifier, gene name, disease identifier, and disease name. The experiments files instead contain the source database, the source score, and the confidence score. For further details please refer to the following Open Access articles about the database: [DISEASES: Text mining and data integration of disease-gene associations](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1046202314003831) and [DISEASES 2.0: a weekly updated database of disease–gene associations from text mining and data integration](https://academic.oup.com/database/article/doi/10.1093/database/baac019/6554833?login=false). The data is made available under the [CC-BY](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license.

dataSources.label: DISEASES: Textmining
dataSources.description:
DISEASES is a weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on disease-gene associations from automatic text mining, manually curated literature, cancer mutation data, and genome-wide association studies. This dataset further unifies the evidence by assigning confidence scores that facilitate comparison of the different types and sources of evidence. All files start with the following four columns: gene identifier, gene name, disease identifier, and disease name. The textmining files contain the z-score, the confidence score, and a URL to a viewer of the underlying abstracts. For further details please refer to the following Open Access articles about the database: [DISEASES: Text mining and data integration of disease-gene associations](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1046202314003831) and [DISEASES 2.0: a weekly updated database of disease–gene associations from text mining and data integration](https://academic.oup.com/database/article/doi/10.1093/database/baac019/6554833?login=false). The data is made available under the [CC-BY](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license.

Data made available under the [CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedication](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

dataSources.label: PharmGKB Primary Data
dataSources.description: The Pharmacogenomics Knowledge Base, PharmGKB, is an interactive tool for researchers investigating how genetic variation affects drug response. [PharmGKB](http://www.pharmgkb.org) displays genotype, molecular, and clinical knowledge integrated into pathway representations and Very Important Pharmacogene (VIP) summaries with links to additional external resources. Users can search and browse the knowledge base by genes, variants, drugs, diseases, and pathways. The Primary Data contains summary information on chemicals, drugs, genes, genetic variants, and phenotypes.

dataSources.label: PharmGKB Relationships Data
dataSources.description:
PharmGKB reports association between chemicals, diseases, genes, and genetic variants, both with themselves and with each other.

Data made available under Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 Intergovernmental Organization (CC BY-SA 4.0 IGO) licence. Explicit licensing for PharmGKB can be viewed on the [download page](https://www.pharmgkb.org/downloads).

dataSources.label: The Tissue Atlas
dataSources.description:
The Human Protein Tissue Atlas contains information about the distribution of proteins on human tissues derived from the antibody-based protein profiling from 44 normal human tissues types and mRNA expression data from 37 different normal tissue types.

This [dataset](https://www.proteinatlas.org/download/normal_tissue.tsv.zip) is available under [CC BY-SA 3.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/). Please also see their [Disclaimer](https://www.proteinatlas.org/about/disclaimer) and [Licence & Citation](https://www.proteinatlas.org/about/licence).

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Institutes of Health: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NIH: NCBI)

dataSources.label: NCBI Assembly
dataSources.description: "The [NCBI Assembly database](www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/) provides stable accessioning and data tracking for genome assembly data. The model underlying the database can accommodate a range of assembly structures, including sets of unordered contig or scaffold sequences, bacterial genomes consisting of a single complete chromosome, or complex structures such as a human genome with modeled allelic variation. The database provides an assembly accession and version to unambiguously identify the set of sequences that make up a particular version of an assembly, and tracks changes to updated genome assemblies. The Assembly database reports metadata such as assembly names, simple statistical reports of the assembly (number of contigs and scaffolds, contiguity metrics such as contig N50, total sequence length and total gap length) as well as the assembly update history. The Assembly database also tracks the relationship between an assembly submitted to the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Consortium (INSDC) and the assembly represented in the NCBI RefSeq project" (Kitts et al. 2016). In this import we include the metadata for all genome assemblies documented in `assembly_summary_genbank.txt` and `assembly_summary_refseq.txt`. Assemblies are stored in GenomeAssembly nodes whose information is integrated from both the GenBank and RefSeq datasets.

dataSources.label: NCBI Gene
dataSources.description: "[NCBI Gene](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene) supplies gene-specific connections in the nexus of map, sequence, expression, structure, function, citation, and homology data. Unique identifiers are assigned to genes with defining sequences, genes with known map positions, and genes inferred from phenotypic information. These gene identifiers are used throughout NCBI's databases and tracked through updates of annotation. Gene includes genomes represented by [NCBI Reference Sequences](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/refseq/) (or RefSeqs) and is integrated for indexing and query and retrieval from NCBI's Entrez and [E-Utilities](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK25501/) systems. Gene comprises sequences from thousands of distinct taxonomic identifiers, ranging from viruses to bacteria to eukaryotes. It represents chromosomes, organelles, plasmids, viruses, transcripts, and millions of proteins."

dataSources.label: NCBI Taxonomy
dataSources.description:
"NCBI Taxonomy "consists of a curated set of names and classifications for all of the source organisms represented in the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC). The NCBI Taxonomy database contains a list of names that are determined to be nomenclaturally correct or valid (as defined according to the different codes of nomenclature), classified in an approximately phylogenetic hierarchy (depending on the level of knowledge regarding phylogenetic relationships of a given group) as well as a number of names that exist outside the jurisdiction of the codes. That is, it focuses on nomenclature and systematics, rather than documenting the description of taxa."

This data is from an NIH human genome unrestricted-access data repository and made accessible under the [NIH Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy](https://osp.od.nih.gov/scientific-sharing/genomic-data-sharing/).

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Institutes of Health: National Library of Medicine

dataSources.label: Medical Subject Headings (MeSH)
dataSources.description: The Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) thesaurus is a controlled and hierarchically-organized vocabulary produced by the National Library of Medicine. It is used for indexing, cataloging, and searching of biomedical and health-related information. Data Commons includes the Concept, Descriptor, Qualifier, Supplementary Concept Record, and Term elements of MeSH as described [here](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/xml_data_elements.html) defined by all four xml files provided by MeSH (desc, pa, qual, and supp). Data Commons includes production year 2024 MeSH.

dataSources.label: PubChem
dataSources.description:
PubChem is the world's largest collection of freely accessible chemical information. Search chemicals by name, molecular formula, structure, and other identifiers. Find chemical and physical properties, biological activities, safety and toxicity information, patents, literature citations and more.

This data is from the National Library of Medicine (NLM) and is not subject to copyright and is freely reproducible as stated in the [NLM’s copyright policy](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/web_policies.html).

dataSourceGroups.label: University of Maryland School of Medicine, Institute of Genome Sciences

dataSources.label: Disease Ontology
dataSources.description:
The Disease Ontology was developed as a project by the Institute of Genome Sciences at the University of Maryland School of Medicine. It "is a community driven, open source ontology that is designed to link disparate datasets through disease concepts". It provides a "standardized ontology for human disease with the purpose of providing the biomedical community with consistent, reusable and sustainable descriptions of human disease terms, phenotype characteristics and related medical vocabulary disease concepts".

The data is made available under [C0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedication](https://disease-ontology.org/resources/citing-do).

dataSources.label: National Prisoner Statistics (NPS) Program
dataSources.description: Data on jurisdiction, custody, admissions, and discharges for prisoners incarcerated in U.S. state and federal prisons.

dataSources.label: Hate Crime Statistics
dataSources.description: Data about U.S. crimes motivated by prejudice based on race, gender and gender identity, religion, disability, sexual orientations, or ethnicity.

dataSources.label: Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) Program
dataSources.description:
Volume of violent crime by type as reported by U.S. city and town law enforcement agencies.

[U.S. Department of Justice legal policies and disclaimers](https://www.justice.gov/legalpolicies)

dataSources.label: Australia Statistics
dataSources.description: Australia demographics, health, and economy statistics at the country, state, and territory levels.

dataSources.label: Australia Subnational Administrative Boundaries
dataSources.description: Administrative boundaries for regions within Australia.

dataSourceGroups.label: Brazil Ministry of Development and Social Assistance, Family and Fight Against Hunger

dataSources.label: Brazil VIS DATA 3
dataSources.description: Census related to the pact against hunger, development programs and facilities provided to the people of Brazil.

dataSourceGroups.label: Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE)

dataSources.label: Brazil Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Brazil.

dataSources.label: India Census Tables
dataSources.description: Data related to demographics, in particular concerning literacy, work, housing, and religion, at the state, district, and city levels.

dataSources.label: Israel Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health, and economy statistics for Israel at the country, district and sub-district levels.

dataSources.label: Ireland Census
dataSources.description: Ireland demographics, health and economy data at the country, county and city levels.

dataSources.label: DataMeet Maps
dataSources.description:
Maps of India sourced from different government websites.

[Terms of use](http://projects.datameet.org/covid19/contributing/)

dataSources.label: Singapore Census
dataSources.description: Demographics and health statistics for Singapore at the country level.

dataSources.label: Regional Statistics by NUTS Classification
dataSources.description:
* [Regions and cities](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/regions-and-cities): NUTS (Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics) geocodes, covering NUTS levels 1 through 3.
* [Demographics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/population-demography) (population, age, gender)
* [Gross domestic product](https://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=nama_10r_3gdp&lang=en): GDP at market prices by NUTS 3 region.
* Health metrics: Life expectancy, fertility, etc.
* Education: Education attainment and participation.

[Terms of use](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/help/copyright-notice)

dataSourceGroups.label: Feeding America
dataSourceGroups.description: A U.S. nonprofit organization that aims to ensure equitable access to nutritious food for all, in partnership with food banks, policymakers, supporters, and communities.

dataSources.label: Feeding America: Map Meal Gap
dataSources.description: Data on food insecurity in the United States.

dataSources.label: Vietnam Census
dataSources.description: Vietnam demographics, economy, health and education data at the country, province and city levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: GeoBoundaries
dataSourceGroups.description: An open database of political administrative boundaries.

dataSources.label: Global Database of Political Administrative Boundaries Database
dataSources.description: Information on administrative boundaries (i.e., state and county) for every country in the world.

dataSources.label: India GeoSadak
dataSources.description: Data about civic structure facilities for India at the district level.

dataSources.label: Google Places
dataSources.description:
Mappings of Google Maps place identifiers to Data Commons entities.

Data made publicly available under the standard [Google terms of service](https://policies.google.com/terms?hl=en).

dataSources.label: India Local Government Directory
dataSources.description:
Provides unique codes for revenue entities such as districts, villages and local government bodies.

[Copyright](https://lgdirectory.gov.in/copyRightPolicy.do) and [terms of use](https://lgdirectory.gov.in/termsconditions.do)

dataSourceGroups.label: Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI)

dataSources.label: Mexico Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Mexico at country and state levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: National Institute of Statistics and Censuses (INDEC)

dataSources.label: Argentina Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Argentina.

dataSources.label: India Life Expectancy by State
dataSources.description: Life expectancy in India based on gender, at the state level, from the National Data and Analytics Platform (NDAP).

dataSources.label: India National Family Health Survey
dataSources.description: Data on India population dynamics and health indicators as well as emerging issues in health and family welfare and associated domains.

dataSources.label: India Poverty Status
dataSources.description: India poverty statistics: percentage of people below the poverty line.

dataSources.label: Kenya Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for Kenya at the country, county and town and suburb levels.

dataSources.label: SouthAfrica Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for South Africa, at the country, province and district municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS)
dataSources.description:
Demographics, health and education data for Uganda at the country, region and district levels.

UBOS [terms of use](https://uganda.opendataforafrica.org/dqgjtcb);[Kenya Census [terms of use](https://kenya.opendataforafrica.org/gdlkmgb)

dataSources.label: The Opportunity Atlas
dataSources.description:
* Outcomes (social mobility and a variety of other outcomes from life expectancy to patent rates) by neighbourhood, college, parental income level and racial background. For U.S. census tracts, counties and commuting zones.
* Neighbourhood characteristics for U.S. census tracts, counties and commuting zones.

dataSourceGroups.label: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

dataSources.label: OECD Regional Demography Statistics
dataSources.description:
Includes regional statistics for OECD countries on population by age, population density, life expectancy and mortality by age group.

[Terms of use](https://www.oecd.org/termsandconditions/)

dataSourceGroups.label: Portal Site of Official Statistics of Japan (e-Stat)

dataSources.label: Japan Census
dataSources.description: Japan demographics, economy, health, and education data at the country, prefecture and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Zurich GeoCoordinates
dataSources.description: Administrative area divisions of Zurich.

dataSources.label: Zurich population

Statistics on Canada demographics, health, education and economy statistics at the country and subnational levels.

dataSources.label: Sweden Census
dataSources.description: Sweden demographics, health and education data at the country, NUTS1, NUTS2, NUTS3 and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: New Zealand Census

dataSourceGroups.label: The Central Bureau of Statistics, Indonesia

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

dataSources.label: Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry (ATSDR)
dataSources.description: Provides health information about hazardous substances and their health effects.

dataSources.label: BRFSS-NCHS Asthma Prevalence
dataSources.description: Statistics on the prevalence of asthma among adults for counties in 50 states and among children for counties in 27 participating states. Data from the 2016–2018 Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) are merged with the 2013 National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) urban-rural classification scheme for counties.

dataSources.label: National Notifiable Diseases Surveillance System (NNDSS)
dataSources.description: Weekly and annual cases of selected national notifiable (infectious and non-infectious) diseases reported by the 50 states, New York City, the District of Columbia, and the U.S. territories.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Compressed Mortality
dataSources.description: Mortality counts for all U.S. states and counties, broken down by underlying cause of death, age, race, sex, and year.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Mortality, Underlying Cause Of Death
dataSources.description: Contains mortality data based on death certificates for U.S. residents.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Natality
dataSources.description:
Includes counts of live births occurring within the United States to U.S. residents. Counts are broken down by a variety of demographic characteristics, such as state and county of residence, mother's race, mother's age, and health and medical items, such as tobacco use, method of delivery, and congenital anomalies. The data are derived from birth certificates.

[Terms of service](https://www.cdc.gov/other/agencymaterials.html)

dataSources.label: Economic Development Administration (EDA)
dataSources.description: Statistics on economic development in the United States, reporting on investments, jobs, and poverty.

dataSources.label: NTIA Internet Use Survey
dataSources.description: Tracks statistics on broadband and Internet access and adoption in the United States.

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

dataSources.label: Income Limits
dataSources.description: Data Commons has imported 80th and 150th percentile median family income estimates for different household sizes for U.S. counties and county subdivisions.

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Center for Education Statistics (NCES)
dataSourceGroups.description: Collects, collates, analyzes, and reports complete statistics on the condition of education in the United States and other nations.

dataSources.label: Public School and School District Data
dataSources.description: General descriptive information and select demographic characteristics about students and staff; and fiscal data such as revenues and current expenditures. Data Commons includes school- and school district-level data about student populations by race, gender, lunch eligibility, and grade, as well as student-teacher ratios and teacher count statistics.

dataSources.label: US Bachelor's Degrees Data
dataSources.description: Bachelor's degrees conferred to (fe)males by postsecondary institutions, by race/ethnicity and field of study.

dataSources.label: US HBCU Data
dataSources.description: Statistics on degree-granting historically Black colleges and universities, by control and level of institution.

dataSources.label: US Private School Data
dataSources.description: General descriptive information; select demographic characteristics about students and staff. Data Commons includes school data about student populations by race, grade, as well as student-teacher ratios and teacher count statistics.

dataSources.label: US STEM Degrees Data
dataSources.description:
Number and percentage distribution of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) degrees/certificates conferred by postsecondary institutions, by race/ ethnicity, level of degree/certificate, and sex of student.

[Data usage agreement](https://nces.ed.gov/surveys/international/ide/datausageagreement.aspx?link=true)

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)
dataSourceGroups.description: Responsible for keeping people safe on America's roadways.

dataSources.label: Fatality Analysis Reporting System (FARS) Crash Data

dataSources.label: UNData

Population data for countries, capital cities, and urban and rural areas not covered by other sources.

UNData [terms of use](http://data.un.org/Host.aspx?Content=UNdataUse); OCHA [terms of Use](https://data.humdata.org/faqs/licenses)

dataSources.label: Sri Lanka Census
dataSources.description: Sri Lanka demographics, education and agriculture statistics at the country, province and district levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: United States Bureau of Transportation Statistics

dataSources.label: US Tract Transportation Characteristics for Households
dataSources.description: Transportation characteristics of U.S.households at the census tract level, including household and demographic information, employment status, vehicle ownership, trips taken, modal choice, and other related transportation data.

dataSources.label: American Community Survey (ACS)
dataSources.description: Covers a broad range of topics about social, economic, demographic, and housing characteristics of the U.S. population. Data Commons includes thousands of variables across the full range of ACS topics at the country, state, county, city, zip code tabulation area, school district, census tract levels, and more.

dataSources.label: Cartographic Boundary Files
dataSources.description: KML files for U.S. counties, states, congressional districts, etc.

dataSources.label: Gazetteer Files
dataSources.description: Basic geographic information about U.S. counties, county subdivisions, congressional districts, states, etc.

dataSources.label: Population Estimates Program (PEP)
dataSources.description: Produces yearly estimates of the population for the United States, its states, counties, cities, and towns, as well as for the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and its municipios. Data Commons imports the total population estimate data for the U.S. at the state, county, and city levels.

dataSources.label: US Decennial Census - Redistricting data
dataSources.description:
Basic population, race demographics and housing statistics from U.S. redistricting data, mapped down to block-group level.

[Terms of service](https://www.census.gov/data/developers/about/terms-of-service.html)

dataSources.label: Candidates & Committees
dataSources.description:
Data about U.S. election candidates, campaigns, contributors, expenditures and contributions.

[Terms of use](https://www.fec.gov/updates/sale-or-use-contributor-information/).

dataSources.label: Wikidata
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes information about administrative divisions, municipalities, cities, villages and neighborhoods of all countries in the world. This also includes population statistics and various well-known identifiers associated with places.

[Terms of use](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

dataSources.description: Datasets related to demographics, economy, education, etc.

dataSources.label: World Bank Official Boundaries

Data Commons includes variables related to demographics, energy, health, labor, etc.

dataSources.label: Regional Statistics by NUTS Classification
dataSources.description:
* [Regions and cities](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/regions-and-cities): NUTS (Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics) geocodes, covering NUTS levels 1 through 3.
* [Demographics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/population-demography) (population, age, gender)
* [Gross domestic product](https://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=nama_10r_3gdp&lang=en): GDP at market prices by NUTS 3 region.
* Health metrics: Life expectancy, fertility, etc.
* Education: Education attainment and participation.

[Terms of use](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/help/copyright-notice)

dataSourceGroups.label: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations

dataSources.label: FAO Currency and Exchange Rate
dataSources.description:
Exchange rates broken down by country, currency standardization type, and currency (using ISO 4217 currency codes).

[Terms of use](https://www.fao.org/contact-us/terms/db-terms-of-use/en/)

dataSources.label: Vietnam Census
dataSources.description: Vietnam demographics, economy, health and education data at the country, province and city levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: India Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation

dataSources.label: Periodic Labour Force Survey
dataSources.description: Wage and salary data for Indian states.

dataSources.label: Global Oceans and Seas
dataSources.description: Represents the boundaries of the 10 main oceans and seas (Arctic Ocean, North and South Atlantic Ocean, North and South Pacific Ocean, Southern Ocean, Indian Ocean, Baltic Sea, Mediterranean Region, South China and Eastern Archipelagic Seas). The boundaries are largely based on the publication 'Limits of Oceans & Seas, Special Publication No. 23', published by the IHO in 1953. The dataset is available in World Geodetic System of 1984 (WGS84). This dataset was composed by the Flanders Marine Data Centre.

dataSourceGroups.label: Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI)

dataSources.label: Mexico Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Mexico at country and state levels.

dataSources.label: India Poverty Status
dataSources.description: India poverty statistics: percentage of people below the poverty line.

dataSourceGroups.label: OpenFIGI
dataSourceGroups.description: A system for identifying global financial instruments. It provides tools for identifying, mapping, and requesting a free Financial Instrument Global Identifier (FIGI).

dataSources.label: FIGI
dataSources.description: A list of global identifiers for financial instruments, including many assets that lack any other comprehensive open identifier such as loans, futures and options and indices.

dataSourceGroups.label: Portal Site of Official Statistics of Japan (e-Stat)

dataSources.label: Japan Census
dataSources.description: Japan demographics, economy, health, and education data at the country, prefecture and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Database on Indian Economy
dataSources.description: Data Commons includes variables related to poverty and unemployment in Indian states.

dataSources.label: Canada Statistics
dataSources.description:
Statistics on Canada demographics, health, education and economy statistics at the country and subnational levels.

[Terms and conditions](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/reference/terms-conditions/general?MM=as)

dataSources.label: GDP by County, Metro, and Other Areas
dataSources.description: Includes U.S. gross domestic product data categorized by county, metro, and other areas.

dataSources.label: Gross Domestic Product
dataSources.description: Gross domestic product data for U.S.counties, metropolitan statistical areas and states, broken down by industry.

dataSources.label: Regional Price Parities by State and Metro Area
dataSources.description:
Price parity data measuring the differences in price levels across U.S. states and metropolitan areas for a given year and expressed as a percentage of the overall national price level.

[Terms of use](https://www.bea.gov/help/faq/147)

dataSources.label: Consumer Price Index
dataSources.description: U.S. consumer price index broken down by categories of consumers.

dataSources.label: Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey
dataSources.description: Survey providing job postings, hires, and separations, broken down by industry.

dataSources.label: Labor Force Statistics from the Current Population Survey (CPS)
dataSources.description: Monthly survey of U.S. households.

dataSources.label: Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS)
dataSources.description: Employment, unemployment, and labor force data for U.S. census regions and divisions, states, counties, metropolitan areas, and many cities, by place of residence.

dataSources.label: Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW)
dataSources.description: U.S. quarterly and annual employment and wage statistics broken down by industry and ownership.

dataSources.label: Economic Development Administration (EDA)
dataSources.description: Statistics on economic development in the United States, reporting on investments, jobs, and poverty.

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

dataSources.label: Income Limits
dataSources.description: Data Commons has imported 80th and 150th percentile median family income estimates for different household sizes for U.S. counties and county subdivisions.

dataSources.label: USA Minimum Wages
dataSources.description: U.S. minimum wages at the state level.

dataSources.label: Weekly Claims and Extended Benefits Trigger Data
dataSources.description:
Weekly new and continuing unemployment insurance claims for U.S. states.

[Terms of use](https://www.dol.gov/general/foia).

dataSources.label: Treasury Nominal and Inflation-Indexed Constant Maturity Series
dataSources.description: Data Commons includes all published statistics for 1-Month, 3-Month, 6-Month, 1-Year, 2-Year, 3-Year, 5-Year, 7-Year, 10-Year, 20-Year, and 30-Year constant maturities.

dataSources.label: US Federal Reserve H.15 Interest Rates
dataSources.description:
U.S. Federal Reserve H.15 interest rates

This data is in the public domain.

dataSources.label: American Community Survey (ACS)
dataSources.description: Covers a broad range of topics about social, economic, demographic, and housing characteristics of the U.S. population. Data Commons includes thousands of variables across the full range of ACS topics at the country, state, county, city, zip code tabulation area, school district, census tract levels, and more.

dataSources.label: County Business Patterns
dataSources.description: U.S. per-industry number of establishments, employment, payroll and annual payroll, by county, metropolitan statistical area and zip code.

dataSources.label: Economic Census
dataSources.description:
Number of U.S. businesses and amount of revenue, by business payroll status, industry, operation type, and tax status.

[Terms of service](https://www.census.gov/data/developers/about/terms-of-service.html)

dataSources.label: World Bank Datasets
dataSources.description: Datasets related to demographics, economy, education, etc.

dataSources.label: World Development Indicators
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes variables related to demographics, energy, health, labor, etc.

[Terms of use](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)

dataSourceGroups.label: Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE)

dataSources.label: Brazil Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Brazil.

dataSourceGroups.label: California Assessment of Student Performance and Progress

dataSources.label: California School Performance
dataSources.description: California schools performance data across different grade levels and sub-groups (e.g. race, disability etc).

dataSources.label: EuroStat Early Education and Training
dataSources.description: Participation in early childhood education by sex (children aged 4 and over) in Europe. The indicator measures the share of the children between the age of four and the starting age of compulsory primary education who participated in early childhood education.

dataSources.label: Regional Statistics by NUTS Classification
dataSources.description:
* [Regions and cities](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/regions-and-cities): NUTS (Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics) geocodes, covering NUTS levels 1 through 3.
* [Demographics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/population-demography) (population, age, gender)
* [Gross domestic product](https://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=nama_10r_3gdp&lang=en): GDP at market prices by NUTS 3 region.
* Health metrics: Life expectancy, fertility, etc.
* Education: Education attainment and participation.

[Terms of use](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/help/copyright-notice)

dataSources.label: Vietnam Census
dataSources.description: Vietnam demographics, economy, health and education data at the country, province and city levels.

dataSources.label: Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE)
dataSources.description: Data related to schools and their resources, including dropout rates and access to computers and toilets, in Indian states and school districts.

dataSourceGroups.label: Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI)

dataSources.label: Mexico Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Mexico at country and state levels.

dataSources.label: Kenya Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for Kenya at the country, county and town and suburb levels.

dataSources.label: SouthAfrica Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for South Africa, at the country, province and district municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS)
dataSources.description:
Demographics, health and education data for Uganda at the country, region and district levels.

UBOS [terms of use](https://uganda.opendataforafrica.org/dqgjtcb);[Kenya Census [terms of use](https://kenya.opendataforafrica.org/gdlkmgb)

dataSourceGroups.label: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

dataSources.label: OECD Regional Education Statistics
dataSources.description:
Includes regional statistics for OECD countries on education by age, education level, and teacher qualification.

[Terms of use](https://www.oecd.org/termsandconditions/)

dataSourceGroups.label: Portal Site of Official Statistics of Japan (e-Stat)

dataSources.label: Japan Census
dataSources.description: Japan demographics, economy, health, and education data at the country, prefecture and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Canada Statistics
dataSources.description:
Statistics on Canada demographics, health, education and economy statistics at the country and subnational levels.

[Terms and conditions](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/reference/terms-conditions/general?MM=as)

dataSources.label: Sweden Census
dataSources.description: Sweden demographics, health and education data at the country, NUTS1, NUTS2, NUTS3 and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: College Scorecard
dataSources.description:
Data about all undergraduate degree-granting institutions of higher education in the U.S.

[Terms of service](https://www2.ed.gov/notices/copyright/index.html)

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Center for Education Statistics (NCES)
dataSourceGroups.description: Collects, collates, analyzes, and reports complete statistics on the condition of education in the United States and other nations.

dataSources.label: Nations Report Card
dataSources.description: National educational performance: assessment score data across different grades, subjects and student categories (e.g. race, disability etc).

dataSources.label: Public School and School District Data
dataSources.description: General descriptive information and select demographic characteristics about students and staff; and fiscal data such as revenues and current expenditures. Data Commons includes school- and school district-level data about student populations by race, gender, lunch eligibility, and grade, as well as student-teacher ratios and teacher count statistics.

dataSources.label: US Bachelor's Degrees Data
dataSources.description: Bachelor's degrees conferred to (fe)males by postsecondary institutions, by race/ethnicity and field of study.

dataSources.label: US HBCU Data
dataSources.description: Statistics on degree-granting historically Black colleges and universities, by control and level of institution.

dataSources.label: US Private School Data
dataSources.description: General descriptive information; select demographic characteristics about students and staff. Data Commons includes school data about student populations by race, grade, as well as student-teacher ratios and teacher count statistics.

dataSources.label: US STEM Degrees Data
dataSources.description:
Number and percentage distribution of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) degrees/certificates conferred by postsecondary institutions, by race/ ethnicity, level of degree/certificate, and sex of student.

[Data usage agreement](https://nces.ed.gov/surveys/international/ide/datausageagreement.aspx?link=true)

dataSources.label: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics
dataSources.description: Data on the status of the science and engineering enterprises in the U.S. and other countries.

dataSourceGroups.label: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UN OCHA)

dataSources.label: Sri Lanka Census
dataSources.description: Sri Lanka demographics, education and agriculture statistics at the country, province and district levels.

dataSources.label: American Community Survey Education Tabulation (ACS-ED)
dataSources.description:
The National Center for Education Statistics collaborates with the U.S. Census Bureau to create a variety of custom data files that describe the condition of school-age children in the United States at the country, state, and school district levels. ACS-ED is updated annually based on ACS five-year period estimates.

[Terms of service](https://www.census.gov/data/developers/about/terms-of-service.html)

dataSources.label: World Bank Datasets
dataSources.description:
Datasets related to demographics, economy, education, etc.

[Terms of use](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)

dataSources.label: Commercial Buildings Energy Consumption Survey (CBECS)
dataSources.description: Energy consumption and expenditures for U.S. commercial buildings, including energy sources across U.S. census regions and divisions.

dataSources.label: Form EIA-860
dataSources.description: Survey that collects generator-level data about electric power plants.

dataSources.label: Open Data
dataSources.description:
County, state, and plant-level data on generation, consumption, and sales for different energy sources and sectors (residential, commercial, etc). Data Commons has imported data about coal, electricity, natural gas, nuclear outages, and petroleum.

[Copyrights and reuse](https://www.eia.gov/about/copyrights_reuse.php).

dataSources.label: RE Atlas
dataSources.description:
Data Commons has imported the potential for solar energy generation in different counties in the U.S.

[Disclaimer](https://maps.nrel.gov/re-atlas/).

dataSources.label: Energy Statistics
dataSources.description:
Data Commons has imported energy data about annual energy production, transformation, and consumption by countries.

UNData [terms of use](http://data.un.org/Host.aspx?Content=UNdataUse); OCHA [terms of Use](https://data.humdata.org/faqs/licenses)

dataSources.label: World Bank Datasets
dataSources.description: Datasets related to demographics, economy, education, etc.

dataSources.label: World Development Indicators
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes variables related to demographics, energy, health, labor, etc.

[Terms of use](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)

dataSourceGroups.label: Brazil INPE - National Institute for Space Research

dataSources.label: BRAZIL INPE Fire Event Count
dataSources.description: Represents counts of fire events in Brazil, at the country and state levels.

dataSources.label: Climate TRACE GHG Emissions
dataSources.description:
Historical data about greenhouse gas emissions from 10 sectors and various sub-sectors, at the country level.

[Terms of use](https://climatetrace.org/terms)

dataSources.label: Temperature Event
dataSources.description: The events for places with unusual temperatures, either too hot or too cold, computed with reference to long-term temperature averages, e.g. the average maximum daily temperature in January over the years 1980-2010.

dataSources.label: WetBulb Temperature Event
dataSources.description: Places with WetBulb temperature exceeding 30 degrees Celsius as per NASA's Modern-Era Retrospective analysis for Research and Applications version 2 (MERRA-2) dataset on Google Earth Engine.

dataSources.label: Inferred Floods from Dynamic World
dataSources.description:
Includes flooded regions computed from the Dynamic World dataset. These are regions labelled as water and outside regions marked as permanent water in the Hansen Global Forest Change dataset.

This dataset is produced for the Dynamic World Project by Google in partnership with National Geographic Society and the World Resources Institute.

dataSources.label: Copernicus ECMWF - ERA5 Climate Reanalysis Data
dataSources.description: The fifth-generation atmospheric reanalysis of the global climate. Reanalysis combines model data with weather observations from across the world into a globally complete and consistent dataset.

dataSources.label: Copernicus Global Land Cover
dataSources.description:
Land cover data. Data Commons currently includes observations for U.S. states and counties.

[Citation for use](https://lcviewer.vito.be/about)

dataSources.label: National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP)
dataSources.description: The FEMA-managed National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) enables homeowners, business owners and renters in participating communities to purchase federally backed flood insurance. This dataset includes insurance claims and amounts paid for flood damage to buildings and their contents, aggregated by census tracts, counties and states.

dataSources.label: National Risk Index
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes relative measures of risk from the 18 natural hazards included in the study for counties and census tracts, as well as annual expected loss figures in U.S. dollars from individual hazards and in aggregate.

Data Commons uses the OpenFEMA API, but is not endorsed by FEMA. The Federal Government or FEMA cannot vouch for the data or analyses derived from the flood data retrieved from the agency's website(s). [Disclaimer](https://hazards.fema.gov/nri/disclaimer).

dataSourceGroups.label: Global Land Ice Measurements from Space (GLIMS)

dataSources.label: Randolph Glacier Inventory
dataSources.description: A global inventory of glaciers, including surface areas.

dataSourceGroups.label: India Water Resources Information System
dataSourceGroups.description: A repository of water resources and related data for India at national, state and district levels.

dataSources.label: India Water Quality
dataSources.description: Water quality data measured at ground and surface water quality stations across India, providing concentrations of dissolved constituents in water in terms of physical, chemical and biological parameters.

dataSources.label: WRIS India Rainfall
dataSources.description: India monthly rainfall data at the district level.

dataSourceGroups.label: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

dataSources.label: Air and GHG emissions
dataSources.description: Country-level air and greenhouse gas emissions data.

dataSources.label: OECD Waste Water Treatment
dataSources.description:
Data on populations connected to waste water treatment, using different methods for different countries.

[Terms of use](https://www.oecd.org/termsandconditions/)

dataSources.label: US Wildfire, Smoke and Drought statistics - County and State
dataSources.description:
This dataset incorporates statistics aggregated by RFF from the following sources:
* [PRISM Climate Group, Oregon State University](https://prism.oregonstate.edu/recent/): Temperature, precipitation, and vapor pressure deficit data
* [gridMET](http://thredds.northwestknowledge.net/thredds/reacch_climate_MET_aggregated_catalog.html?dataset=agg_met_pdsi_1979_CurrentYear_CONUS): Palmer Drought Severity Index (PDSI) data
* [Parks & Abatzoglou (2020)](https://datadryad.org/stash/dataset/doi:10.5061/dryad.tmpg4f4x1): Data on forest cover and fire severity in the western U.S.
* [U.S. Census Bureau](https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/datasets/2020-2021/counties/totals/): County-level population estimates
* MTBS Project (USDA Forest Service/U.S. Geological Survey)(http://mtbs.gov/direct-download): Fire-level geospatial data
* [Childs et al. 2022](https://www.stanfordecholab.com/wildfire_smoke): Data on PM2.5 from wildfire smoke

All data is made available for non-commercial purposes only.

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

dataSources.label: Environmental Health Toxicology
dataSources.description: Data Commons has imported data on Palmer Drought Severity Index, Standardized Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index, Standardized Precipitation Index, ozone, and PM2.5.

dataSources.label: Heat & Heat-related Illness (HRI)
dataSources.description:
Includes data about various heat-stress-induced medical incidents.

[Terms of service](https://www.cdc.gov/other/agencymaterials.html)

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

dataSources.label: NEX - Downscaled Climate Projections for US from IPCC CMIP5
dataSources.description:
Atmospheric variables from multiple CMIP5 climate models for the United States.

[Tech note](https://www.nccs.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/NEX-DCP30_Tech_Note.pdf).

dataSources.label: NEX - Global Downscaled Climate Projections from IPCC CMIP5
dataSources.description:
Atmospheric variables from multiple CMIP5 climate models for the entire world.

[Tech note](https://esgf.nccs.nasa.gov/esgdoc/NEX-GDDP_Tech_Note_v0.pdf).

dataSources.label: NEX - Global Downscaled Climate Projections from IPCC CMIP6
dataSources.description:
Atmospheric variables from multiple CMIP6 climate models for the entire world.

[Tech note](https://www.nccs.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/NEX-GDDP-CMIP6-Tech_Note.pdf).

dataSources.label: PO.DAAC - Sea level Projections from IPCC CMIP6
dataSources.description: Sea level projections from 2020 to 2150 for all future scenarios in CMIP6 on a regular global grid and local projections at individual tide gauge locations.

dataSources.label: VIIRS Active Fire Data
dataSources.description: The Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) aboard the S-NPP satellite provides 375m resolution data for active fires. This dataset includes area under fire per level 13 S2 cell every day starting in 2012.

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)

dataSources.label: GPCC Monthly SPI Data
dataSources.description: Historical monthly Standardized Precipitation Index (SPI), calculated from data observed by the German Meteorological Service (Deutscher Wetterdienst).

dataSources.label: International Best Track Archive for Climate Stewardship (IBTrACS)
dataSources.description: Tropical cyclone data. Data Commons includes cyclone name, start date, end date, max wind speed, minimum pressure, max classification, oceanic basin, and affected places.

dataSources.label: NOAA CoastWatch
dataSources.description: Sea surface salinity and temperature data mapped to S2 cells.

dataSources.label: NOAA-EPA Observed Weather Data
dataSources.description: Historical weather data from stations reported largely from NOAA Global Historical Climate Network (GHCN).

dataSources.label: NOAA-GFS Weather Forecast
dataSources.description: Global daily weather forecast generated from the National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) model.

dataSources.label: National Climatic Data Center Storm Events Database
dataSources.description:
Occurrence in the U.S. of storms and other significant weather phenomena having sufficient intensity to cause loss of life, injuries, significant property damage, and/or disruption to commerce; rare, unusual, weather phenomena that generate media attention, such as snow flurries in South Florida or the San Diego coastal area; and other significant meteorological events, such as record maximum or minimum temperatures or precipitation that occur in connection with another event.

[Terms of use](https://www.weather.gov/disclaimer)

dataSources.label: National Interagency Fire Center Interagency Situation Report - 209 (SIT-209)
dataSources.description:
Information related to U.S. wildland fire management incidents and resources.

[Terms of use](https://www.fs.usda.gov/about-agency/disclaimers-important-notices)

dataSourceGroups.label: United States Bureau of Transportation Statistics

dataSources.label: US Tract Transportation Characteristics for Households
dataSources.description: Transportation characteristics of U.S.households at the census tract level, including household and demographic information, employment status, vehicle ownership, trips taken, modal choice, and other related transportation data.

dataSources.label: Air Data
dataSources.description: Air quality data collected from outdoor monitors on the county, Core Based Statistical Areas (CBSAs), and site monitor levels.

dataSources.label: EJSCREEN
dataSources.description: Environmental justice mapping tool based on environmental and demographic indicators.

dataSources.label: Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program
dataSources.description: Annual reporting of greenhouse gases from large emission sources.

dataSources.label: National Emissions Inventory
dataSources.description: Provides estimates of air emissions of criteria pollutants, hazardous pollutants and greenhouse gases at the U.S. county level. Estimates are based on 188 on-road air emission sources (mobile sources such as highway and border crossing vehicles electricity measurement), 248 non-road air emissions sources (mobile sources such as off-highway vehicle gasoline measurement), 703 non-point air emissions sources (such as industrial processes, oil and gas exploration and production) and 5818 point air emissions sources (such as chemical and organic solvent evaporation measurement).

dataSources.label: Superfund Sites
dataSources.description:
Site contamination data, hazard scores and more.

[Disclaimers and terms of use](https://www.epa.gov/web-policies-and-procedures/epa-disclaimers)

dataSources.label: National Water Use Data
dataSources.description:
Water use data for states and counties in the U.S., broken down by water source (ground water, surface water), water type (fresh water, saline water), and category of use (domestic, industrial, etc.).

[Copyrights and credits terms of service](https://www.usgs.gov/information-policies-and-instructions/copyrights-and-credits)

dataSources.label: World Bank Datasets
dataSources.description:
Datasets related to demographics, economy, education, etc.

[Terms of use](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)

dataSources.label: Australia Statistics
dataSources.description: Australia demographics, health, and economy statistics at the country, state, and territory levels.

dataSources.label: Israel Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health, and economy statistics for Israel at the country, district and sub-district levels.

dataSources.label: Ireland Census
dataSources.description: Ireland demographics, health and economy data at the country, county and city levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: Dartmouth Atlas Project
dataSourceGroups.description: This project uses Medicare and Medicaid data to provide information and analysis about national, regional, and local markets, as well as hospitals and their affiliated physicians.

dataSources.label: Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes the following datasets:
* Medicare reimbursements
* Medicare mortality rates
* Selected primary care access
* Quality measures

[Terms of use](https://data.dartmouthatlas.org/terms-of-use/)

dataSources.label: COVID-19
dataSources.description:
Provides cleaned datasets relating to COVID-19 in India, sourced from various government websites.

[Terms of use](http://projects.datameet.org/covid19/contributing/)

dataSources.label: Singapore Census
dataSources.description: Demographics and health statistics for Singapore at the country level.

dataSources.label: EuroStat Health
dataSources.description: Statistics measuring both objective and subjective aspects of people's health in Europe. They cover different kinds of health-related aspects, including key indicators on the functioning of the health care systems and health and safety at work.

dataSources.label: Regional Statistics by NUTS Classification
dataSources.description:
* [Regions and cities](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/regions-and-cities): NUTS (Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics) geocodes, covering NUTS levels 1 through 3.
* [Demographics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/population-demography) (population, age, gender)
* [Gross domestic product](https://appsso.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/nui/show.do?dataset=nama_10r_3gdp&lang=en): GDP at market prices by NUTS 3 region.
* Health metrics: Life expectancy, fertility, etc.
* Education: Education attainment and participation.

[Terms of use](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/help/copyright-notice)

dataSourceGroups.label: Feeding America
dataSourceGroups.description: A U.S. nonprofit organization that aims to ensure equitable access to nutritious food for all, in partnership with food banks, policymakers, supporters, and communities.

dataSources.label: Feeding America: Map Meal Gap
dataSources.description: Data on food insecurity in the United States.

dataSources.label: Vietnam Census
dataSources.description: Vietnam demographics, economy, health and education data at the country, province and city levels.

dataSources.label: COVID-19 Community Mobility Reports
dataSources.description:
Reports chart virus movement trends over time by geography, across different categories of places such as retail,recreation, groceries, pharmacies, parks, transit stations, workplaces, and residences. Data Commons includes all statistics for countries, U.S. states, and U.S. counties.

Data made publicly available under the standard [Google terms of service](https://policies.google.com/terms?hl=en).

dataSourceGroups.label: India National Health Mission
dataSourceGroups.description: A flagship program of the Government of India to address the health needs of under-served rural areas and health concerns of the urban poor population.

dataSources.label: Health Management Information System
dataSources.description: Captures medical facility-level information such as reproductive, maternal and child health, immunization, family planning and vector-borne diseases on a monthly basis at district, state and national levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: India National Sample Survey
dataSourceGroups.description: Organizes and conducts large-scale all-India sample surveys on different population groups in diverse socio-economic areas, such as employment, consumer expenditure, housing conditions and environment, literacy levels, health, nutrition, family welfare, etc.

dataSources.label: India National Sample Survey - Health
dataSources.description:
Household health survey on the profile of ailments including their treatment, role of government and private facilities in providing healthcare, expenditure on medicines, expenditure on medical consultation and investigation, hospitalization and expenditure, maternity and childbirth, the condition of the aged, etc.

[Terms of use](https://ndap.niti.gov.in/info?tab=termsandconditions)

dataSourceGroups.label: Mexico National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI)

dataSources.label: Mexico Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Mexico at country and state levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: National Institute of Statistics and Censuses (INDEC)

dataSources.label: Argentina Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Argentina.

dataSources.label: India National Family Health Survey
dataSources.description: Data on India population dynamics and health indicators as well as emerging issues in health and family welfare and associated domains.

dataSources.label: Kenya Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for Kenya at the country, county and town and suburb levels.

dataSources.label: SouthAfrica Census
dataSources.description: Demographics, health and education data for South Africa, at the country, province and district municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Uganda Bureau of Statistics (UBOS)
dataSources.description:
Demographics, health and education data for Uganda at the country, region and district levels.

UBOS [terms of use](https://uganda.opendataforafrica.org/dqgjtcb);[Kenya Census [terms of use](https://kenya.opendataforafrica.org/gdlkmgb)

dataSources.label: COVID-19 Vaccinations
dataSources.description:
Data Commons imports country-level COVID-19 vaccine data.

[Terms of use](https://ourworldindata.org/faqs#how-should-i-cite-your-work)

dataSourceGroups.label: Portal Site of Official Statistics of Japan (e-Stat)

dataSources.label: Japan Census
dataSources.description: Japan demographics, economy, health, and education data at the country, prefecture and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: Canada Statistics
dataSources.description:
Statistics on Canada demographics, health, education and economy statistics at the country and subnational levels.

[Terms and conditions](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/reference/terms-conditions/general?MM=as)

dataSources.label: Sweden Census
dataSources.description: Sweden demographics, health and education data at the country, NUTS1, NUTS2, NUTS3 and municipality levels.

dataSources.label: New Zealand Census
dataSources.description: Demographics and statistics for New Zealand at the country, district and city levels.

dataSourceGroups.label: The Central Bureau of Statistics, Indonesia

dataSources.label: Indonesia Census
dataSources.description: Population census and statistics for Indonesia at the country, province, regency and city levels.

dataSources.label: Coronavirus (Covid-19) Data in the United States
dataSources.description:
Cumulative counts of coronavirus cases in the United States at the country, state, and county levels, over time. The New York Times compiles this time series data from state and local governments and health departments. Data Commons imports this data and computes incremental counts.

Data made [available for non-commercial purposes only with proper citation](https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/blob/master/LICENSE)

dataSourceGroups.label: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

dataSources.label: Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry (ATSDR)
dataSources.description: Provides health information about hazardous substances and their health effects.

dataSources.label: BRFSS-NCHS Asthma Prevalence
dataSources.description: Statistics on the prevalence of asthma among adults for counties in 50 states and among children for counties in 27 participating states. Data from the 2016–2018 Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) are merged with the 2013 National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) urban-rural classification scheme for counties.

dataSources.label: Diabetes Surveillance System
dataSources.description: Estimates of the number and percentage of U.S. adults with diabetes.

dataSources.label: Heat & Heat-related Illness (HRI)
dataSources.description: Includes data about various heat-stress-induced medical incidents.

dataSources.label: National Notifiable Diseases Surveillance System (NNDSS)
dataSources.description: Weekly and annual cases of selected national notifiable (infectious and non-infectious) diseases reported by the 50 states, New York City, the District of Columbia, and the U.S. territories.

dataSources.label: National Outbreak Reporting System (NORS)
dataSources.description: Data from reports of foodborne and waterborne disease outbreaks and enteric (intestinal) disease outbreaks spread by contact with environmental sources, infected people or animals, and other means.

dataSources.label: PLACES: Local Data for Better Health
dataSources.description: Provides model-based, population-level analysis and community estimates of health measures for all counties, places (incorporated and census-designated places), census tracts, and zip code tabulation areas (ZCTAs) across the United States.

dataSources.label: Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System (PRAMS)
dataSources.description: Annual survey that gathers data on various health measures for pregnant women and their babies.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Compressed Mortality
dataSources.description: Mortality counts for all U.S. states and counties, broken down by underlying cause of death, age, race, sex, and year.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Mortality, Underlying Cause Of Death
dataSources.description: Contains mortality data based on death certificates for U.S. residents.

dataSources.label: Wonder: Natality
dataSources.description:
Includes counts of live births occurring within the United States to U.S. residents. Counts are broken down by a variety of demographic characteristics, such as state and county of residence, mother's race, mother's age, and health and medical items, such as tobacco use, method of delivery, and congenital anomalies. The data are derived from birth certificates.

[Terms of service](https://www.cdc.gov/other/agencymaterials.html)

dataSourceGroups.label: UK Ministry of Housing Communities and Local Government

dataSources.label: IMD2019
dataSources.description: Statistics on relative deprivation in small areas in England.

dataSources.label: Small Area Health Insurance Estimates (SAHIE)
dataSources.description:
Provides yearly estimates of health insurance coverage status for all U.S. counties and states. Data Commons includes all estimates, available by age, race, sex, and income.

[Terms of service](https://www.census.gov/data/developers/about/terms-of-service.html)

dataSources.label: ARCOS Retail Drug Summary Reports
dataSources.description:
Data collected from manufacturers and distributors reporting on controlled substances transactions. Data Commons includes quarterly retail drug distributions from ARCOS Report 1, provided annually from 2006-2017. Please see the [disclaimers](https://datacommons.org/disclaimers) page about the methodology and scope of the data available in Data Commons.

[Legal policies and disclaimers](https://www.justice.gov/legalpolicies).

dataSources.label: World Development Indicators
dataSources.description:
Data Commons includes variables related to demographics, energy, health, labor, etc.

[Terms of use](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses)

dataSources.label: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Dashboard
dataSources.description:
COVID-19 cases and death counts for countries across the world.

Data made available under [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0 IGO](https://www.who.int/about/policies/publishing/copyright)

dataSources.label: American Community Survey (ACS)
dataSources.description: Covers a broad range of topics about social, economic, demographic, and housing characteristics of the U.S. population. Data Commons includes thousands of variables across the full range of ACS topics at the country, state, county, city, zip code tabulation area, school district, census tract levels, and more.

dataSources.label: US Decennial Census - Redistricting data
dataSources.description:
Basic population, race demographics and housing statistics from U.S. redistricting data, mapped down to block-group level.

[Terms of service](https://www.census.gov/data/developers/about/terms-of-service.html)
